page.title: 06 Light Industry
page.content: There is no heavy industry in our area; only small-scale light industrial units, such as the ink-manufacturing company where Melanie's father works as a research chemist. His job is to work on small samples of ink, blending colours until the right colour is formed., according to the "recipe" in company's books. If the colour is right, then larger quantities go into production. It is used mainly for printing on fabrics, plates and posters. The basic process of manufacture is from coloured pigment powders, which are first mixed to give a syrupy consistency, then thinned to the required consisitency for use.
